intro: Potentilla staminea, commonly known as white potentilla, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and covered in a fine layer of silvery hairs, giving them a distinctive appearance. The plant is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, making it a hardy species often found in alpine environments.
